communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the deaths of the following individuals:

1. Name: Jose Flores, Date of birth: 10-21-1981, Date of death: 04-19-2021
2. Name: Steven Quintana, Date of birth: 06-16-2005, Date of death: 05-19-2022

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at dillon@muckrock.com, or by phone at (267) 314-7952.

Thank you.

Best,
Dillon Bergin

title: Pete Sumalo Montejo ICE Death Report

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pete Sumalo Montejo ICE Death Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The ICE Detainee Death Report for Pete Sumalo Montejo, who passed away December 5, 2025, in ICE custody in Texas. 
2. A copy of the ICE ERO or IHSC Significant Incident Report or Significant Event Notification

According to the information currently published on ICE's website, ICE was under a Congressional mandate to release this information no later than 30 days after his death, and to update it no more than 60 days after each immigrant's death. ICE has released a Death Report for Jean Wilson Brutus and Shiraz Sachwani, both of whom died after Mr. Sumalo Montejo. 

I make this request under both 5 USC 552(a)(2) - which governs the agency's affirmative disclosure obligations - and 552(a)(3), which concerns the agency's obligation to respond to a request. 

Pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e)(1)(ii) and (iv), I seek expedited processing of this request, and certify and attest under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and current understanding: 

1. I am a member of the media, primarily engaged information dissemination. See www.MuckRack.com/Andrew-Free.

2. I research and publish regarding deaths in ICE custody. My work documenting deaths in ICE detention is published, cited, and relied upon by national media outlets, including the Washington Post, the New York Times, the L.A. Times, and others. 

3. As of the date of filing my filing of this request, ICE has not posted its Detainee Death Report for this individual. 

4. There is an urgent need to inform the public about the circumstances ICE is aware of surrounding this death. Congress is currently contemplating alterations to DHS and ICE's funding, and the facts of each death in custody directly impact demands lawmakers and the public may wish to press when authorizing future funding increases, or applying limits to them.

5. Deaths in ICE custody reached their highest numbers in 20 years in 2025, and they have been the subject of widespread media coverage, and there is significant reason to believe ICE's treatment of people in detention has not met the standards it claims it adheres to when defending its actions in public statements. This coverage has prompted a number of responses by DHS's Twitter page and other public statements, pushing back against the coverage.

6. I will make the records available to the general public upon receiving them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Deaths-in-custody
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

The database or records of all Illinois law enforcement agencies deaths-in-custody up to the date this request is ultimately fulfilled, including all deaths-in-custody reported pursuant both Illinois state legislation (730 ILCS 210/3-5) and federal legislation (34 U.S.C. § 60105), as well as all data dictionaries, database scheme documentation or other documentation on the collection and organizatin of the data. 

I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, we additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Audit letters of compliance for Danbury, CT 2018-2024

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Audit letters of compliance for Danbury, CT 2018-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Management Letters: All final "Management Letters" or "Letters to Those Charged with Governance" issued by the City’s external auditors (including but not limited to CliftonLarsonAllen LLP) for the fiscal years ending 2018 through 2025.

2. Internal Control Deficiencies: Any written communications from external auditors regarding "significant deficiencies" or "material weaknesses" in the City’s internal controls related to departmental compliance with the City Charter, specifically regarding the qualification of officers under Charter Section 2-5.

3. Compliance Testing Records: Any audit "working papers" or summaries in the City's possession that document the testing of Oaths of Office for the Health Department Directors (Fernanda Carvalho, Kara Prunty, and Lisa Morrissey).

4. Single Audit Compliance: For the years 2018–2024, please provide the "Report on Compliance for Each Major State/Federal Program" that specifically addresses the Health Department’s adherence to administrative legal requirements.

Public Interest & Urgency: These records are of vital public interest following the $17 million verdict in Girolametti v. Danbury, which established a pattern of "reckless disregard" within City departments. The failure of three consecutive Health Directors to file mandatory Oaths of Office suggests a systemic failure of internal controls that the auditors were tasked to identify.

I request a response within the statutory four business days. If any portion of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption and provide the name of the official responsible for the denial.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Paige

communications.communication:

I request copies of records related to Temporary Flight Restriction FDC 6/2233 over El Paso International Airport (KELP), effective February 11–21, 2026.

Specifically, I request:

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Arapahoe County Flock ALPR
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

Please provide the audit data in a structured format such as .csv, .xls, or another machine-readable database filetype.

3. Data Sharing
a. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data.
b. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data.
c. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information.
d. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information.

4. ALPR Locations: Please provide the precise location of each Flock Safety ALPR camera deployed and utilized by the Arapahoe County Sheriff's Office.

You may find that these requests result in a large number of files. These exports from the Flock system are standardized data formats that are inconsequential to redact. To remove private information, simply omit the "License Plate" column. Others have found that other agencies have had trouble with this until they realized they could do this.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Zephyrine Groves

title: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

1. All departmental or municipal policies regarding communication and information sharing between departmental officers or employees and federal agents/agencies within the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) or the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), including but not limited to the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). The records request includes, but is not limited to, policies regarding: 

A. Fingerprint and other data sharing, 

B. ICE detainer requests,   

C. Compliance with federal immigration enforcement efforts, including guidance or policies around when communication with ICE officers is allowed, and 

D. Communicating with federal immigration enforcement officers. 

This request covers any policies that are currently in effect or that have been in effect at any point on or after January 20, 2025. 

2. The five most recent communications (e.g., emails, text messages, call logs or transcripts, or otherwise) between a departmental officer or employee and a federal DHS or ICE employee concerning immigration matters. In addition, I request all records related to these communications, including, but not limited to, any records indicating that the department was made aware of the communications, discussions of their content or implications, evaluations them for compliance with departmental or other city policies, identification or acknowledgement of any potential policy violations, and any internal responses, disciplinary actions, or follow-up measures resulting from these communications. 

3. All records relating to incidents, if any, from January 20, 2025, to the day this request is responded to, in which an individual was taken from the department’s custody directly into ICE custody. For each incident, the records request includes, but is not limited to, booking and transfer records, communications with ICE or other federal agencies, internal documentation or discussion of the transfer, and internal notes, memos, or documentation referencing communication with DHS or ICE.

For each request, I am not seeking identifying information, and I will accept anonymized or redacted data as necessary to protect identities. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest. I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Joshua Dankoff 

Joshuadankoff@cfjj.org  

Director of Strategic Initiatives 

Citizens for Juvenile Justice  

(submitted via MuckRock platform)

communications.subject: State of California Public Records Act Request Confirmation - REQ-2026-3214 CRM:0001828
communications.communication:
Logged in as: Msf Msf

Thank you for contacting the California Department of Motor Vehicles (CADMV) to obtain records pursuant to the Public Records Act. (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.) Your request, dated Tuesday, February 10, 2026, will be processed. Reference Number REQ-2026-3214 has been assigned for tracking purposes. Please refer to this reference number when accessing the CADMV Public Records Act Center Portal to monitor the progress of your request.

Under California law, CADMV must respond to your inquiry within 10 calendar days from receipt of the request to notify you whether records will be disclosed. Please note that any request submitted after 5:00 p.m. Monday – Friday, or on a holiday or weekend, will be deemed “received” the following business day for purposes of the Public Records Act. If fees are required, CADMV will notify you of the cost to obtain the records. Any required fees must be paid before releasing the records. Please note that some records are exempt from disclosure. If the requested records are exempt, we will inform you in writing as to why.

The Public Records Act provides that CADMV may extend the 10-day response period by up to 14 additional calendar days under certain circumstances. We will notify you within 10 days of receipt of your request if a 14-day extension is necessary.

Please visit the CADMV Public Records Act Center Portal to monitor the progress of your request.

title: CISA: Industrial Supply Chain Disinformation Analysis (2014-2016) - #ColumbianChemicals hoax

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CISA: Industrial Supply Chain Disinformation Analysis (2014-2016) - #ColumbianChemicals hoax
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a request for records generated by the National Protection and Programs Directorate (NPPD) and later CISA related to the Columbian Chemicals hoax in 2014. For context, this incident was covered in a detail article in The New York Times Magazine: https://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/07/magazine/the-agency.html

Post-Action Reports & Situation Assessments: Any final reports, situation summaries, or briefings produced by the National Protection and Programs Directorate (NPPD) or the Office of Cybersecurity and Communications (CS&C) regarding the September 11, 2014, hoax involving the Columbian Chemicals facility in Centerville, LA.

Industrial Impact Analysis: Any non-classified memoranda discussing the potential impact of the #ColumbianChemicals hoax on the U.S. rubber and automotive supply chains, including any internal assessments of whether the hoax targeted the market position of the Aditya Birla Group.

Communication with Private Entities: Records of formal communications between the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and representatives of Columbian Chemicals or Birla Carbon between September 11, 2014, and December 31, 2014, specifically regarding the public response to the disinformation campaign.

Foreign Actor Attribution: Any non-classified memos or briefing slides prepared for the DHS Secretary or the National Security Council that mention the Internet Research Agency (IRA) or Russian-affiliated "troll farms" in direct connection to the 2014 Louisiana chemical plant hoax.

If certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for CISA's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Officer Disciplinary Records - E Kuznetsov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

During an incident on 2/9 involving an ICE vehicle, a Minnetonka Police Officer is seen on video shoving a women while her back is turned. The officer appears to be wearing badge 193, with a nameplate listing "E Kuznetsov". We are seeking information about this officer's training and disciplinary records, including:
1) Complaints filed against the officer from their start date through the date you fulfill this request. Please include substantiated/investigated complaints as well as any there may have been deemed unsubstantiated. We do NOT want any identifying information of the individuals who made the complaints. 
2) All personnel file records referring to disciplinary actions, reprimands, corrective actions, performance evaluations reflecting misconduct, and sustained force findings for Officer E. Kuznetsov.
3) Complete training history for Officer E. Kuznetsov, including course titles, agencies providing training, completion certificates/grades, and dates, specifically: Use-of-Force/De-Escalation training, Crowd Control / Mass Demonstration training, Less-Lethal Weapon / Tactics training, Any annual in-service or refresher training related to force or public order.

Please reach out with any questions, I'm happy to provide clarification if needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records: Giovanni Edward McNab
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Bureau records mentioning, and associated digital media (photo and video files) pertaining to, the late Giovanni Edward McNab, also known as Gio McNab, who was shot and killed in an exchange of gunfire with a US Marshall SOG team in Chippewa County Michigan, at 7299 East 27 Mile Road, Goetzville, 49774. 

An attached image of the preliminary death certificate on August 16, 2023 by the Medical Examiner of Chippewa County Michigan shall serve as proof of McNab having passed away on August 9, 2023; as such, privacy concerns recognized under FOIA and the Privacy Act are diminished. 

To assist in the identification of records: 
— the FBI case #89B-DE-3798417; 
— the first five digits of McNab's Social Security Number were 615-38-; 
— his birth month/year was February 22, 1989; 
— media reports of his death were published beginning on August 10, 2023.  

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System including  (but not limited to) ELSUR Records System, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mike McNab

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Suffolk County police disciplinary files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Invoices, contracts, order forms, quotes, procurement documents between the Monterey County Sherriff's Office and Flock Group Inc, dba Flock Safety between January 1, 2023 and the date this request is processed.

2. The names of all the agencies with which data is shared with through the Flock Safety automated license plate reader system.

3. The names of all the agencies from which data is received through the Flock Safety automated license plate reader system.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Greene

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Alexandria VA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request the contract that the district entered into with a vendor for the stop arm camera pilot (50 buses). 

Additionally any applicable intergovernmental agreements with the City of Alexandria and/or the police department for the enforcement of school bus stop arm camera violations. 

Lastly, any records related to the procurement of the vendor stop-arm camera contract.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Jon Smith.
